methods.name: CreateStorageContainer
methods.documentation: CreateStorageContainer enables you to create a Virtual Volume (VVOL) storage container. Storage containers are associated with a  account, and are used for reporting and resource allocation. Storage containers can only be associated with virtual volumes. You need at least one storage container to use the Virtual Volumes feature.

params.name: name
params.documentation: Name of the storage container. Follows  account naming restrictions.

params.name: accountID
params.documentation: Non-storage container account that will become a storage container.

params.name: initiatorSecret
params.documentation: The secret for CHAP authentication for the initiator.

params.name: targetSecret
params.documentation: The secret for CHAP authentication for the target.

methods.name: ListStorageContainers
methods.documentation: ListStorageContainers enables you to retrieve information about all virtual volume storage containers known to the system.

params.name: storageContainerIDs
params.documentation: A list of storage container IDs for which to retrieve information. If you omit this parameter, the method returns information about all storage containers in the system.

methods.name: GetStorageContainerEfficiency
methods.documentation: GetStorageContainerEfficiency enables you to retrieve efficiency information about a virtual volume storage container.

params.name: storageContainerID
params.documentation: The ID of the storage container for which to retrieve efficiency information.

members.documentation: Information about the newly created storage container.
members.name: storageContainer

members.documentation: List of objects containing information about all storageContainers in the system.
members.name: storageContainers

members.documentation: The volumes that could not be queried for efficiency data. Missing volumes can be caused by the Garbage Collection (GC) cycle being less than an hour old, temporary loss of network connectivity, or restarted services since the GC cycle.
members.name: missingVolumes

members.documentation: The last time efficiency data was collected after Garbage Collection (GC).
members.name: timestamp

types.documentation:
The storageContainer object contains the attributes of a virtual volume storage container. You can
		 retrieve this information for  each storage container in the cluster using the API method ListStorageContainers.
types.name: storageContainer

members.documentation: The ID of the  account associated with the storage container.
members.name: accountID

members.documentation: The CHAP authentication secret for the initiator associated with the storage container.
members.name: initiatorSecret

members.documentation: The name of the storage container.
members.name: name

members.documentation:
The storage container's protocol endpoint type. SCSIis the only value returned for the pro
		tocol endpoint type.
members.name: protocolEndpointType

members.documentation:
The status of the storage container. Possible values:Active: The storage container is in u
		se.Locked: The storage container is locked.
members.name: status

members.documentation: The unique ID of the storage container.
members.name: storageContainerID

members.documentation: The CHAP authentication secret for the target associated with the storage container.
members.name: targetSecret

members.documentation: A list of the virtual volumes associated with the storage container.
members.name: virtualVolumes
